tit.cmt: この項目は中国発祥の事柄に関する内容となっており、もちろん日本、韓国、ベトナム、その他の国も多少記述されていますが主に中国に関しての内容です。そうなると英訳した場合、中国に関する内容の部分では、漢字の発音が中国読みである必要があると考え訳し分けしています。

sen.j: 律令（りつりょう）とは、東アジアでみられる法体系である。
sen.e: Luli ("律令" or "律例," pronounced as "Luli") is the common terms of a legal code system seen among Eastern Asian countries.
Luli ("律令" or "律例," pronounced as "Luli") is a common term for a legal code system seen among the Eastern Asian countries.
sen.cmt: 文法を修正致しました。
sen.e: Luli ("律令" or "律例," pronounced as "Luli") is a common term for a legal code system seen among the Eastern Asian countries.

sen.j: 律は刑罰法令、令は律以外の法令（主に行政法）に相当する。
sen.e: Lu ("律")corresponds to the penalty codes, while Li ("令"or "例") indicates the codes of law (mainly the administrative law) other than the penalty codes.
Lu ("律")corresponds to the penalty codes, while Li ("令"or "例") indicates the codes of law (mainly the administrative law) other than the penalty codes.
Lu ("律")corresponds to the penalty codes, while Li ("令"or "例") indicates the codes of law (mainly the administrative law) other than the penalty codes.

sen.j: 律令の基本思想は、儒家と法家の思想である。
sen.e: The essential concepts of Luli were derived from the ideas of Confucianism and Legalism.
The essential concepts of Luli were derived from the ideas of Confucianism and Legalism.
The essential concepts of Luli were derived from the ideas of Confucianism and Legalism.

sen.j: 儒家の徳治主義に対して、法家は法律を万能とする法治主義である。
sen.e: The house of Confucian insisted on the ruling of a society with kindness and virtue for its foundation, while the house of law advocated a utilitarian concept, which sought for the establishment and practice of a law system within a society.

The house of Confucian insisted on the ruling of a society with kindness and virtue for its foundation, while the house of law advocated a utilitarian concept, which sought for the establishment and practice of a law system within a society.

The house of Confucian insisted on the ruling of a society with kindness and virtue for its foundation, while the house of law advocated a utilitarian concept, which sought for the establishment and practice of a law system within a society.

sen.j: 古代中国には、国家や社会秩序を維持する規範として、礼、楽、刑（法）、兵（軍事）があった。
sen.e: In ancient Chinese societies, the precepts of "Li," ("礼,"largely understood as rituals, although it also suggests the ideas of customs, etiquette, morals) "Yueh," ("楽,"classic of music) "Xing" or "Xingfa ("刑"or "刑法," written codes of penalty and punishment) "Fa" ("兵,"military treaties and also military affairs) were established to maintain states and public order.

In ancient China, the precepts of "Li," ("礼,"largely understood as rituals, although it also suggests the ideas of customs, etiquette, morals) "Yueh," ("楽,"classic of music) "Xing" or "Xingfa ("刑"or "刑法," written codes of penalty and punishment) "Fa" ("兵,"military treaties and also military affairs) were established to maintain the nation and public order.
sen.cmt: 古代中国は、ancient Chinaで十分だと考えsocietiesを削除致しました。また、statesをnationに改めました。
sen.e: In ancient China, the precepts of "Li," ("礼,"largely understood as rituals, although it also suggests the ideas of customs, etiquette, morals) "Yueh," ("楽,"classic of music) "Xing" or "Xingfa ("刑"or "刑法," written codes of penalty and punishment) "Fa" ("兵,"military treaties and also military affairs) were established to maintain the nation and public order.

sen.j: 儒家は礼・楽を、法家は刑・兵を重んじた。
sen.e: The school of Confucian considered Li and Yueh as its principal concepts, while the school of law regarded Xing and Fa highly for its practice.
The school of Confucian considered Li and Yueh as its principal concepts, while the school of law regarded Xing and Fa highly for its practice.
The school of Confucian considered Li and Yueh as its principal concepts, while the school of law regarded Xing and Fa highly for its practice.

sen.j: 刑の成文法として律が発達し、令はその補完的規範であった。
sen.e: Lu was developed and established as the statutory law of Xing, along with the supplemental norms enacted as Li.
Lu developed as the statutory law of Xing, and Li was its supplemental norm.
sen.cmt: 文を平易に致しました。
sen.e: Lu developed as the statutory law of Xing, and Li was its supplemental norm.

sen.j: 次第に令の重要性が増して、律から独立し行政法的なものになった。
sen.e: The importance of Li gradually increased, and it was isolated to become an administrative law system.
The importance of Li gradually increased, and it was isolated from Lu to become an administrative law system.
sen.cmt: 「律から」が訳漏れでしたので、補いました。
sen.e: The importance of Li gradually increased, and it was isolated from Lu to become an administrative law system.

sen.j: 律令は魏晋南北朝時代に発達し、7世紀～8世紀の隋唐期には最盛期を迎え、当時の日本や朝鮮諸国（特に新羅）へも影響を与えた。
sen.e: Luli was developed throughout Wei-Jin/Southern and Northern Dynasty period and thoroughly established in Sui Dynasty during 7th to 8th century, which influenced the surrounding nations including Japan and the kingdoms of Korea. (especially Silla)

Luli was developed during the Wei-Jin/Southern and Northern Dynasty period, reaching its zenith in Sui Dynasty from the seventh to eighth century, and had an influence on Japan and the kingdoms of Korea (especially Silla) at the time.
sen.cmt: "surrounding nations including"は不要と考え、削除致しました。
sen.e: Luli was developed during the Wei-Jin/Southern and Northern Dynasty period, reaching its zenith in Sui Dynasty from the seventh to eighth century, and had an influence on Japan and the kingdoms of Korea (especially Silla) at the time.

sen.j: この時期の中国を中心とする東アジア諸国では共通して、律令に基づく国家統治体制が構築されていた。
sen.e: Chinese dynasties as the center of the development of Luli, the ruling and administrative order based on Luli system was commonly established in each of those Eastern Asian countries.
Chinese dynasties as the center of the development of Luli, the ruling and administrative order based on Luli system was commonly established in each of those Eastern Asian countries.
Chinese dynasties as the center of the development of Luli, the ruling and administrative order based on Luli system was commonly established in each of those Eastern Asian countries.

sen.j: このような統治体制を律令制（または律令体制）という。
sen.e: This ruling and administrative order is defined as Luli System.
This ruling and administrative order is defined as the Luli System.
sen.cmt: Luli systemの前に"the"が必要なため、追記致しました。
sen.e: This ruling and administrative order is defined as the Luli System.

sen.j: ただし、律令制のあり方は各国により異なるところもあった。
sen.e: However, there were some differences in the actual circumstances and practice of Luli System in each country.
However, there were some differences in the actual circumstances and practice of the Luli System in each country.
sen.cmt: Luli systemの前に"the"が必要なため、追記致しました。
sen.e: However, there were some differences in the actual circumstances and practice of the Luli System in each country.

sen.j: 各国の律令制は、およそ8世紀中期～9世紀ごろに相次いで崩壊または弛緩していった。
sen.e: Luli system of each country collapsed or weakened by mid 8th century to 9th century one after another.
The Luli system in each countries collapsed or weakened one after another by the mid eighth to the ninth century.
sen.cmt: Luli systemの前に"the"が必要なため、追記致しました。また、８，９世紀をスペルアウト致しました。
sen.e: The Luli system in each countries collapsed or weakened one after another by the mid eighth to the ninth century.

sen.j: （→詳しくは律令制を参照のこと。）
sen.e: (Refer to "Luli System" for details)
(Refer to "Luli System" for details)
(Refer to "Luli System" for details)

sen.j: 律令制という制度は、律令や格式などの法令群により規定づけられていた。
sen.e: The system of Luli was provided by the series of written precepts including the principal concepts of Luli, formalities, and social rules.
The system of Luli was provided by the series of written precepts including the principal concepts of Luli, formalities, and social rules.
The system of Luli was provided by the series of written precepts including the principal concepts of Luli, formalities, and social rules.

sen.j: これらの法令群の概念を総称して律令法という。
sen.e: The general concept and the comprehensive system of these precepts is defined as a Luli System.
The general concept and the comprehensive system of these precepts are defined as a Luli System.
sen.cmt: 文法を修正致しました。
sen.e: The general concept and the comprehensive system of these precepts are defined as a Luli System.

sen.j: つまり、律令法の作用を受けて、律令制という制度が構築されていたのであり、両者は密接な関係にあったと言えるが、両者は別個の概念であり混同しないよう注意しなければならない。
sen.e: It is important not to confuse Luli with Luli System--each was a separate and an individual concept even though both were closely related, as Luli System was established upon the effects and circumstances of Luli Codes.

In other words, the Luli System was established upon the effects and circumstances of the Luli Codes, and it is important not to confuse the two, since even if it could be said that they were closely related, they were two different concepts.
sen.cmt: 「--」は不要と判断し、削除致しました。また、「別個の概念」をより平易な表現に修正致しました。
sen.e: In other words, the Luli System was established upon the effects and circumstances of the Luli Codes, and it is important not to confuse the two, since even if it could be said that they were closely related, they were two different concepts.

sen.j: 東アジア各国で制度としての律令制が崩壊・消滅してしまった後も、法典としての律令法は多かれ少なかれ変質しながらも存続していき、法令としての効力をある程度保っていた。
sen.e: Even after the collapse or discontinuation of Luli as a ruling and administrative system, the codes of Luli remained with certain effectiveness by altering its form and application among each Eastern Asian country.

Even after the collapse or the discontinuation of the Luli as a ruling and administrative system among each of the Eastern Asian countries, the codes of Luli as a law code remained by altering its form and application to some extent, and kept its force as a law.
sen.cmt: 「法典としての律令法は多かれ少なかれ」や「法令としての効力」が訳漏れ（それとも意訳なのでしょうか）でしたので、補いました。
sen.e: Even after the collapse or the discontinuation of the Luli as a ruling and administrative system among each of the Eastern Asian countries, the codes of Luli as a law code remained by altering its form and application to some extent, and kept its force as a law.

sen.j: （→詳しくは律令法を参照のこと。)
sen.e: (Refer to "Luli Code" for details)
(Refer to "Luli Code" for details)
(Refer to "Luli Code" for details)

tit.cmt: より平易な表現に修正致しました。

sen.j: 歴史上最初の律令は、中国の西晋が268年（泰始4）に制定した泰始律令である。
sen.e: The first Luli found in the history is Qin Shi Luli enacted in 268 during the ruling of Western Jin Dynasty.
The first Luli to be found in history was Qin Shi Luli which was enacted in 268 during the Western Jin Dynasty in China.
sen.cmt: 「中国の」を追記致しました。また、"ruling of"は不要と考え削除致しました。
sen.e: The first Luli to be found in history was Qin Shi Luli which was enacted in 268 during the Western Jin Dynasty in China.

sen.j: これ以前の中国法制では特に律と令の区分はなかったが、このとき初めて、社会規範を規定する律と統治体制を規定する令が明確に区別され、体系的な統一法典としての律令が登場することとなった。
sen.e: There had been no separation between Lu and Li in earlier Chinese legislation, therefore this was the first establishment of Luli as a system developed on collective codes, with clear separation of Lu defining the social standards and norms, and Li prescribing the ruling system.

There were no classifications between Lu and Li in the earlier Chinese legislations, and this was therefore the first establishment of Luli as a system developed on collective codes with clear classification of Lu defining the social standards and norms, and Li prescribing the ruling system.

There were no classifications between Lu and Li in the earlier Chinese legislations, and this was therefore the first establishment of Luli as a system developed on collective codes with clear classification of Lu defining the social standards and norms, and Li prescribing the ruling system.

sen.j: 西晋が滅亡した後も南北朝時代 (中国)の諸王朝によって律令が制定・公布された。
sen.e: After the downfall of Western Jin Dynasty, each dynasty in China during Southern and Northern Dynasty period proclaimed and enacted Luli of its own.
After the downfall of the Western Jin Dynasty, each dynasty in China during the period of the Northern and Southern Dynasties proclaimed and enacted Luli of its own.
sen.cmt: 「西晋」と「南北朝時代」についてdynastyの前に、theを追記致しました。
sen.e: After the downfall of the Western Jin Dynasty, each dynasty in China during the period of the Northern and Southern Dynasties proclaimed and enacted Luli of its own.

sen.j: 中国を再統一した隋の楊堅は、581年に開皇律令を公布したが、これは高度に体系化・整備された内容を持ち、律令の一つの完成形とされている。
sen.e: Yan Jiang succeeded to unify China and established Sui Dynasty, and later he proclaimed Kaihuang Luli in 581, which is considered to be one of the highly polished and complete forms of Luli with developed and systematized contents.
Yan Jiang who reunited China as the Sui Dynasty, later proclaimed Kaihuang Luli in 581, which was considered to be one of the completed forms of Luli with highly developed and systematized contents.
sen.cmt: 文頭やpolishedという単語を修正し、平易な文章に致しました。
sen.e: Yan Jiang who reunited China as the Sui Dynasty, later proclaimed Kaihuang Luli in 581, which was considered to be one of the completed forms of Luli with highly developed and systematized contents.

sen.j: 文帝の次の煬帝や隋に代わって中国を統一した唐の皇帝たちも律令を制定・公布したが、これらは開皇律令を概ね踏襲している。
sen.e: The successor of Wen, (Civil Emperor) Yang of Sui Dynasty, and also the emperors of Tang Dynasty succeeded Sui Dynasty proclaimed and enacted Luli, which were based on Kaihuang Luli.
Yang-di who succeeded Emperor Wen, as well as the emperors of the Tang Dynasty that succeeded the Sui Dynasty proclaimed and enacted Luli, which were based on Kaihuang Luli.
sen.cmt: Trans 1の"(Civil Emperor) Yang of Sui Dynasty"について、訳の根拠が記されておりませんでした。そのため、用語統一(用語集）に掲載されているもので書き換えました。
sen.e: Yang-di who succeeded Emperor Wen, as well as the emperors of the Tang Dynasty that succeeded the Sui Dynasty proclaimed and enacted Luli, which were based on Kaihuang Luli.

sen.j: 中国史上、律令制が全盛を迎えたのは、隋から唐中期にかけての時期とされている。
sen.e: It is considered that the peak of this Luli system was from the period of Sui Dynasty to the mid Tang Dynasty.
It is considered in Chinese history that Luli system was at the zenith from the period of Sui Dynasty to the mid Tang Dynasty.
It is considered in Chinese history that Luli system was at the zenith from the period of Sui Dynasty to the mid Tang Dynasty.

sen.j: 律令を運用していく中で、律令に規定していない状況が生まれたり、律令の法理と現実の状況が乖離することがある。
sen.e: Actual management and practice of Luli could occasionally face with some situations not prescribed in Luli codes, therefore the law codes of Luli often lost touch with the reality of societies.
In the course of putting Luli in to practice, there were situations which the Luli codes had not stipulated, and the legal principles of Luli was in alienation from the reality.
sen.cmt: 文法を修正致しました。
sen.e: In the course of putting Luli in to practice, there were situations which the Luli codes had not stipulated, and the legal principles of Luli was in alienation from the reality.

sen.j: そのため、律令の規定を補足・改正する格（きゃく）や律令や格を実際に施行する上での細則である式（しき）が制定されるようになった。
sen.e: Then, "格" ("Ge") for supplemental or amendment purposes and "式" ("Shi") for actual enforcement of Luli and Ge as their bylaws were also developed and enacted.
Therefore, "格" ("Ge") for supplemental or amendment purposes, and "式" ("Shi") for the actual enforcement of Luli and Ge as their bylaws were also developed and enacted.
sen.cmt: Thenよりthereforeの方が文がより分かり易くなります。
sen.e: Therefore, "格" ("Ge") for supplemental or amendment purposes, and "式" ("Shi") for the actual enforcement of Luli and Ge as their bylaws were also developed and enacted.

sen.j: これを格式（きゃくしき）というが、唐2代皇帝の太宗 (唐)が制定した貞観格式が最初の格式である。
sen.e: These additionally issued supplement and bylaws are called "格式," ("Geshi") first established as Zhenguan Geshi by the second emperor of Tang Dynasty, Taizong.
These additionally issued supplement and bylaws were called "格式," ("Geshi") first established as Zhenguan Geshi by the second emperor of Tang Dynasty, Taizong.
sen.cmt: 文法を修正致しました。
sen.e: These additionally issued supplement and bylaws were called "格式," ("Geshi") first established as Zhenguan Geshi by the second emperor of Tang Dynasty, Taizong.

sen.j: なおこの頃、唐の強い影響のもとで、日本や新羅において律令制定の動きが見られた。
sen.e: The strong influence of Tang Dynasty during this time period propagated Luli System to be established within the surrounding countries, such as Japan or Silla.
Furthermore, movements to establish the Luli System was seen in Japan and Silla around this time by the strong influence of Tang Dynasty.
sen.cmt: "surrounding countries"の根拠が不明です。日本や新羅のみで訳出致しました。
sen.e: Furthermore, movements to establish the Luli System was seen in Japan and Silla around this time by the strong influence of Tang Dynasty.

sen.j: （後述中国周辺諸国の律令を参照。)
sen.e: (Refer to the following section, "Luli of the surrounding nations of China for details)
(Refer to the following section on "Luli of the surrounding nations of China.")
sen.cmt: "for details"は余分と考え、削除致しました。
sen.e: (Refer to the following section on "Luli of the surrounding nations of China.")

sen.j: 国家体制としての律令制は、唐後期までに崩壊していたが、それでも律令格式という法体系は基本法典として存続し、唐以後の諸王朝（北宋・明・清）も律令格式の法形式を継承していった。
sen.e: As a ruling and administrative system of a nation, Luli was no longer effective by the end of Tang Dynasty, while Luli Geshi as a law system remained as the essential collective of law codes, to be succeeded by the following dynasties of China applying the form of Luli Geshi for their law enforcement.

Luli as a ruling and administrative system of a nation, was no longer effective by the end of Tang Dynasty, but a law system referred to as Luli Geshi remained as the essential collective of law codes, and the form of Luli Geshi was succeeded by the dynasties after Tang (Northern Song, Ming, and Qing) as their law enforcement.
sen.cmt: （北宋・明・清）が訳漏れです。
sen.e: Luli as a ruling and administrative system of a nation, was no longer effective by the end of Tang Dynasty, but a law system referred to as Luli Geshi remained as the essential collective of law codes, and the form of Luli Geshi was succeeded by the dynasties after Tang (Northern Song, Ming, and Qing) as their law enforcement.

tit.e: Luli of the surrounding nations of China
Luli of the surrounding nations of China
Luli of the surrounding nations of China

sen.j: 律令は、中国の影響を受けた周辺諸国でも制定された。
sen.e: Luli was also established among those surrounding nations influenced by the dynasties of China.
Luli was also established among the surrounding nations that were influenced by the dynasties of China.
Luli was also established among the surrounding nations that were influenced by the dynasties of China.

sen.j: 日本では、唐の脅威にさらされた7世紀後期、国力の充実強化を目的として、律令の概念が積極的に受容され、まず先駆的な律令として飛鳥浄御原令が制定された。
sen.e: In Japan, the early adaptation of Ritsuryo (Japanese pronunciation of Luli) took form and established as Asuka Kiyomihara Ryo as the influence of Tang Dynasty and its threat was becoming larger in late 7th century, thus it was necessary for Japanese government to actively adapt the concept of Ritsuryo in order to reinforce and substantiate the form and the strength as a nation.
sen.cmt: ここでは日本の律令について記述していますので、説明を加えた上で律令を「Ritsuryo」としています。
sen.e: In Japan, the concept of Ritsuryo was actively adopted in order to reinforce and substantiate national power against the threat of the Tang during the late seventh century, and Asuka Kiyomihara Ryo was first established as the pioneer of Ritsuryo.
sen.cmt: 「受容」は受け入れ取り込むことなので、adaptという適応を意味する単語ではなく、採用を意味するadoptがよいと考え修正致しました。その他、文を平易に致しました。
sen.e: In Japan, the concept of Ritsuryo was actively adopted in order to reinforce and substantiate national power against the threat of the Tang during the late seventh century, and Asuka Kiyomihara Ryo was first established as the pioneer of Ritsuryo.

sen.j: ついで、701年の大宝律令により律令の完成を見た。
sen.e: Succeeding, Ritsuryo was fully established by the enactment of Taiho Ritsuryo in 701.
Subsequently, the Ritsuryo saw its completion in the enactment of the Taiho Ritsuryo in 701.
sen.cmt: 「ついで」の訳語を修正致しました。
sen.e: Subsequently, the Ritsuryo saw its completion in the enactment of the Taiho Ritsuryo in 701.

sen.j: しかし、757年に施行された養老律令以降、新たな律令は制定されなかった（追加法として刪定律令・刪定令格が制定された事があるが程なく廃止されている）。
sen.e: However, Ritsuryo was no longer proclaimed in Japan after Yoro Ritsuryo enacted in 757. (Additional and supplemental law code, Santei Ritsuryo and Santei Ryokaku were enacted later, but those were also discontinued soon later)

However, the Ritsuryo was no longer enacted in Japan after the enactment of Yoro Ritsuryo in 757 (additional and supplemental law code, Santei Ritsuryo and Santei Ryokaku were enacted later, but they were also abrogated soon afterward).
sen.cmt: soon laterという表現を修正致しました。
sen.e: However, the Ritsuryo was no longer enacted in Japan after the enactment of Yoro Ritsuryo in 757 (additional and supplemental law code, Santei Ritsuryo and Santei Ryokaku were enacted later, but they were also abrogated soon afterward).

sen.j: 格式は、本来唐では律令と同時に制定されたが､日本では大宝律令が制定されてから例・式といったかたちで随時公布されていた。
sen.e: Kyakushiki (Japanese pronunciation of Geshi) was usually simultaneously enacted together with Luli (Ritsuryo) in the case of Tang Dynasty, but Kyakushiki was proclaimed separately as Ryo or Shiki after the establishment of Taiho Ritsuryo.

Kyakushiki (Japanese pronunciation of Geshi) was usually enacted simultaneously with Luli (Ritsuryo) in the Tang Dynasty, but in Japan, it was enacted separately as Ryo or Shiki after the establishment of Taiho Ritsuryo whenever necessary.
sen.cmt: 「日本では」と「随時」が訳漏れです。
sen.e: Kyakushiki (Japanese pronunciation of Geshi) was usually enacted simultaneously with Luli (Ritsuryo) in the Tang Dynasty, but in Japan, it was enacted separately as Ryo or Shiki after the establishment of Taiho Ritsuryo whenever necessary.

sen.j: 9世紀から10世紀にかけて格式の法制整備が進み、弘仁格式・貞観格式・延喜格式（三代格式）が編纂された。
sen.e: The legislation of Kyakushiki was developed during the period of 9th to 10th century, and three major Kyakushiki (Sandai Kyakushiki) of Kounin Kyakushiki, Jyougan Kyakusiki, and Engi Kyakushiki were compiled and edited in Japan.

The legislation of Kyakushiki was developed over the ninth and the tenth century, and three major Kyakushiki (Sandai Kyakushiki) which were Kounin Kyakushiki, Jyougan Kyakushiki, and Engi Kyakushiki were compiled and edited.
sen.cmt: 文末の"in Japan"は原文に無いため、削除致しました。
sen.e: The legislation of Kyakushiki was developed over the ninth and the tenth century, and three major Kyakushiki (Sandai Kyakushiki) which were Kounin Kyakushiki, Jyougan Kyakushiki, and Engi Kyakushiki were compiled and edited.

sen.j: その後、律令格式に基づく統治体制が限界を迎え、地方の国司や有力者への大幅な権限委譲による統治体制へと転換したため、格式が編纂されることもなくなった。
sen.e: However, Kyakushiki was no longer issued to public after a ruling and administrative system based on Ritsuryo and Kyakushiki reached their limit as the authority of governing was mostly transferred to provincial officials and influential person of each region.

However, Kyakushiki was no longer compiled, for the ruling and administrative system based on the Ritsuryo and Kyakushiki reached their limit as it evolved into the ruling system by provincial officials and influential person of each region through large devolution of authority.
sen.cmt: 「編纂される」は、compiledで足りると考え修正致しました。
sen.e: However, Kyakushiki was no longer compiled, for the ruling and administrative system based on the Ritsuryo and Kyakushiki reached their limit as it evolved into the ruling system by provincial officials and influential person of each region through large devolution of authority.

sen.j: 朝鮮半島では、7世紀中葉ごろ、高句麗・百済との緊張が高まっていた新羅により、律令受容の試みが行われていた。
sen.e: In mid 7th century in Korean Peninsula, Silla of the three kingdoms of Korea adapted Luli during the period when the tensions against Koguryo and Baekje was becoming stronger.
sen.cmt: この韓国における律令についての記述ですが、韓国語での発音はわかりかねます。中国が起源ということで、中国語読みにて英訳しています。
sen.e: Around the mid seventh century in the Korean Peninsula, Silla of the three kingdoms of Korea adopted Luli tentatively during the period when the tensions against Koguryo and Baekje ran high.
sen.cmt: 「ごろ」を訳出し、部分的に表現を修正致しました。
sen.e: Around the mid seventh century in the Korean Peninsula, Silla of the three kingdoms of Korea adopted Luli tentatively during the period when the tensions against Koguryo and Baekje ran high.

sen.j: 7世紀後期、新羅は朝鮮半島の統一と唐の影響を抑制することに成功し、唐律令を参考としながらも独自の律令制を構築した。
sen.e: In the later 7th century, Shilla succeeded to unify Korean Peninsula and managed to restrain the interference of Tang Dynasty, then its unique Luli System was established upon referring to the Luli of Tang Dynasty.

In the late seventh century, Silla succeeded in unifying the Korean Peninsula and restraining the interference of the Tang Dynasty, and although making reference to the Luli of Tang Dynasty, it constructed its own Luli System.
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より分かり易い文章となるように致しました。また、新羅がShillaになっておりましたので、これまでの訳の通りSillaに修正致しました。
sen.e: In the late seventh century, Silla succeeded in unifying the Korean Peninsula and restraining the interference of the Tang Dynasty, and although making reference to the Luli of Tang Dynasty, it constructed its own Luli System.

sen.j: 新羅は自前の律令は制定せず、唐律令を採用していたが、独自色の強い格を多数制定することにより、新羅独特の国家体制を築いた。
sen.e: While Luli of Shilla was not developed from scratch as it was adapted the essential concept of Tang Luli, Shilla enacted various Ge unique to its own in order to establish a particular system suitable of Shilla.
Silla adopted the Tang Luli, and did not enact Lilu that they created from scratch, but by enacting various Ge which had characteristics strong of Silla, it established its own form of government.
sen.cmt: 文法を修正しながら、書き換えました。ShillaはSillaに修正致しました。
sen.e: Silla adopted the Tang Luli, and did not enact Lilu that they created from scratch, but by enacting various Ge which had characteristics strong of Silla, it established its own form of government.

sen.j: 10世紀に朝鮮を統一した高麗は独自の律令を制定したが、これはほぼ唐律令を引き写した内容となっていた。
sen.e: Kingdom of Goryeo that unified Korean Peninsula in 10th century mostly copied Tang Luri in order to establish Luri of its own essential system.
Kingdom of Goryeo that unified the Korean Peninsula in the 10th century mostly copied from the Tang Luri in order to establish Luli of its own.
sen.cmt: Luliの綴りがLuriになっておりましたので、修正致しました。
sen.e: Kingdom of Goryeo that unified the Korean Peninsula in the 10th century mostly copied from the Tang Luri in order to establish Luli of its own.

sen.j: ベトナムは長らく中国王朝の支配を受けており、形式上は中国王朝の律令が適用されていた。
sen.e: Vietnam was under the ruling of Chinese dynasties throughout its history, and Chinese Luli was mostly applied for ruling and administrating the dependency.
Vietnam was under the ruling of Chinese dynasties for a long time, and Chinese Luli was applied as a formality.
sen.cmt: 文を平易に致しました。
sen.e: Vietnam was under the ruling of Chinese dynasties for a long time, and Chinese Luli was applied as a formality.

sen.j: 李朝 (ベトナム)期（11世紀）に北宋から事実上の独立を果たし、独自の律令格式を制定するようになった。
sen.e: Ly Dynasty of Vietnam (11th century) achieved independence from Northern Song, and it established its own unique Luli Geshi.
Ly Dynasty of Vietnam (11th century) achieved independence from Northern Song, and it established its own Luli Geshi.
sen.cmt: uniqueは余分なので、削除致しました。
sen.e: Ly Dynasty of Vietnam (11th century) achieved independence from Northern Song, and it established its own Luli Geshi.

sen.j: 次の陳朝でも律令法典が制定された。
sen.e: The succeeding Trần Dynasty also enacted its own Luli-oriented law codes.
The succeeding Trần Dynasty also enacted its own Luli-oriented law codes.
The succeeding Trần Dynasty also enacted its own Luli-oriented law codes.

sen.j: その後、明に服属する時期もあったが、黎朝が再度、中国王朝から独立した15世紀には、律令格式が積極的に編纂された。
sen.e: After Trần Dynasty, there were some time periods when Vietnam was ruled by Chinese dynasties, but Lê Dynasty achieved independence from China in 15th century and actively compiled and edited its own Luli Geshi.

After the Trần Dynasty, there were times when Vietnam was ruled by Chinese dynasties, but the Lê Dynasty achieved independence from China in the 15th century and actively compiled and edited its own Luli Geshi.
sen.cmt: some time periodsなどの表現を修正致しました。
sen.e: After the Trần Dynasty, there were times when Vietnam was ruled by Chinese dynasties, but the Lê Dynasty achieved independence from China in the 15th century and actively compiled and edited its own Luli Geshi.

sen.j: 次の阮朝も19世紀前期に律令を制定している。
sen.e: The succeeding Nguyễn Dynasty also enacted its own Luli in the early 19th century.
The succeeding Nguyễn Dynasty also enacted its own Luli in the early 19th century.
The succeeding Nguyễn Dynasty also enacted its own Luli in the early 19th century.

sen.j: その他、8世紀頃に唐周辺に見られた諸国（渤海 (国)や吐蕃王朝）は、自前の律令は制定しなかったが、唐律令制を積極的に受容・改変し、独自の律令制を立てていた。
sen.e: Among other neighbouring countries existed during 8th century, (ex. Balhae or Tibetan Empire) they did not developed their own Luli but they positively adapted and altered Tang Luli for applying Luli Systems suitable for their own conditions and unique requirements.

Moreover, the neighbouring countries that existed around Tang during the eighth century (ex. Balhae or Tibetan Empire), did not enact Luli that they created from scratch, but positively adapted and altered the Tang Luli to make the Luli System of their own.
sen.cmt: 「唐周辺に」が訳漏れでしたので、追記致しました。
sen.e: Moreover, the neighbouring countries that existed around Tang during the eighth century (ex. Balhae or Tibetan Empire), did not enact Luli that they created from scratch, but positively adapted and altered the Tang Luli to make the Luli System of their own.

sen.j: また、10世紀に現れた遼（契丹）や12世紀に現れた金 (王朝)も律令制も採用し、独自の律令を制定していた。
sen.e: Also, Liao Dynasty (Khitan/Khitai) established in 10th century and Jin (Chin) Dynasty appeared in 12th century also adopted Luli System and established their own Luli for practice of the system.

In addition, the Liao Dynasty (Khitan/Khitai) which was established in 10th century and the Jin (Chin) Dynasty which emerged in 12th century also adopted the Luli System and established their own system.
sen.cmt: alsoが二度続くので、文頭をin additionに修正致しました。
sen.e: In addition, the Liao Dynasty (Khitan/Khitai) which was established in 10th century and the Jin (Chin) Dynasty which emerged in 12th century also adopted the Luli System and established their own system.

tit.cmt: 「秦始」を中国読みで、「律令」を日本語記述・読みとしているのに疑問を感じます。英語表記だと混ざっていることがわからなくなります。ただ、「律令」という記述が中国読みで見つからず、日本語読みとしています。（通常、中国では「律令」とせず「律」のみの場合が多いようです。その場合、読みは「lu」となるようです。たまにある「律例」の表記を中国読みすると、「Luli」と考えられます。ただ、ここでの原文は「律令」とされていますので日本語読みの「Ritsuryo」とせざるを得ませんでしたのでご了承下さい。Luliとした方が良い場合はそちらを利用していただいた方が良いかと思います。

sen.cmt: 数字だけエクセルに入れると書式が規定できませんので便宜上A.D.を入れています。必要なければ削除下さい。

sen.e: The first Luli law code
The first Luli law code
The first Luli law code

sen.j: 日本の仁井田陞による輯逸書。
sen.e: This is a book of recollected notes from lost reference books edited and compiled by a Japanese scholar of law history, Noboru NIIDA.
This is a book of recollected notes from lost reference books edited and compiled by a Japanese scholar of law history, Noboru NIIDA.
This is a book of recollected notes from lost reference books edited and compiled by a Japanese scholar of law history, Noboru NIIDA.

tit.cmt: 発音が満州語読みだと記述してわからなくなりますので、すでに英訳されたものとしました。

sen.e: Qing Dynasty
Qing Dynasty
Qing Dynasty

sen.j: - 668年ごろ制定？実在を疑う意見も多い。
sen.e: It was assumed to be enacted around 668, but many scholar suggest the existence of the code can not be proved.
It was assumed to be enacted around 668, but many scholars deny its existence.
sen.cmt: 文を平易に致しました。
sen.e: It was assumed to be enacted around 668, but many scholars deny its existence.
It was enacted in 689.
It was enacted in 689.
It was enacted in 689.

sen.j: 律令制構築のための先駆的な律令法典。
sen.e: The early adaptation of Chinese Luli for collecting law codes to establish Ritsuryo System in Japan.
The pioneer of Ritsuryo law codes for erecting the Ritsuryo System.
sen.cmt: 文を平易に致しました。
sen.e: The pioneering Ritsuryo law codes for erecting the Ritsuryo System.
It was enacted in 701.
It was enacted in 701.
It was enacted in 701.
The full-scale law codes of Ritsuryo.
The full-scale law codes of Ritsuryo.
The full-scale law codes of Ritsuryo.
It was enacted in 757.
It was enacted in 757.
It was enacted in 757.

sen.j: 大宝律令を一部修正したもの。
sen.e: This was the altered version of Taiho Ritsuryo.
This was the revised version of Taiho Ritsuryo.
sen.cmt: 表現が自然になるよう修正致しました。
sen.e: This was the revised version of Taiho Ritsuryo.
It was enacted in 791.
It was enacted in 791.
It was enacted in 791.
This was the additional/supplemental codes to Yoro Ritsuryo.
This was the supplemental codes to Yoro Ritsuryo.
sen.cmt: supplementalで足りると考え、additional/を削除致しました。
sen.e: This was the supplemental codes to Yoro Ritsuryo.
It was ineffective for its use by 812. (practically discontinued)
It became ineffective (practically abrogated) in 812.
sen.cmt: 表現が自然になるよう修正致しました。
sen.e: It became ineffective (practically abrogated) in 812.
It was enacted in 797.
It was enacted in 797.
It was enacted in 797.
This was the additional/supplemental codes to Yoro Ritsuryo.
This was the supplemental codes to Yoro Ritsuryo.
sen.cmt: supplementalで足りると考え、additional/を削除致しました。
sen.e: This was the supplemental codes to Yoro Ritsuryo.
It was ineffective by early 9th century.
It was presumed to be abrogated in the early ninth century.
sen.cmt: ?を訳出した文に書き換えました。
sen.e: It was presumed to be abrogated in the early ninth century.

tit.cmt: 分かり易い表現に致しました。
